argument.description: The value used to find the smallest integer value.

description: The PostgreSQL ceil function returns the smallest integer value that is greater than or equal to a number.
sample:
postgres=# SELECT ceil(32.65);
 ceil
------
   33
(1 row)

postgres=# SELECT ceil(32.1);
 ceil
------
   33
(1 row)

postgres=# SELECT ceil(32);
 ceil
------
   32
(1 row)

postgres=# SELECT ceil(-32.65);
 ceil
------
  -32
(1 row)

postgres=# SELECT ceil(-32.1);
 ceil
------
  -32
(1 row)

postgres=# SELECT ceil(-32);
 ceil
------
  -32
(1 row)
